reasoning: Multiple sclerosis is a well-studied chronic demyelinating disease of the central nervous system. Global incidence approximately 3 per 100k person-years based on epidemiological surveys. Prevalence varies by geography (lower in tropics, higher in temperate regions), averaging ~100 per 100k globally. Data from WHO reports and peer-reviewed epidemiological literature.
source: Multiple global epidemiological surveys and MS registries (2000-2010)
